metadata.title: CVE-2019-9506 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: The Bluetooth BR/EDR specification up to and including version 5.1 permitssufficiently low encryption key length and does not prevent an attackerfrom influencing the key length negotiation. This allows practicalbrute-force attacks (aka "KNOB") that can decrypt traffic and injectarbitrary ciphertext without the victim noticing.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
